sentence: He’s walking all over you and our allies.” And on the campaign trail, Ohio Senate GOP candidate Jane Timken said “the U.S. must respond with strength and stand with Ukraine.” Those statements fall largely within a historical GOP tenet that a foreign policy guided by robust involvement overseas best keeps America safe.
author: The Hill via Nexstar Media Wire
title: Ukraine poses test for fractured GOP

author: Eric Garcia
title: How the war in Ukraine is affecting Republican primaries

sentence: “You don’t know squat,” Gibbons is heard jabbing at the former state treasurer’s experience in the private sector, after which Mandel, a veteran, responds, “Two tours in Iraq, don’t tell me I haven’t worked.” The men repeatedly told each other to back off before standing eye-to-eye for several seconds, while fellow GOP debate participants Matt Dolan, Jane Timken and JD Vance looked on awkwardly.
title: Ohio GOP Senate debate turns nasty as Gibbons and Mandel go nose-to-nose

sentence: Former Ohio Republican Party Chairwoman Jane Timken, former Ohio Treasurer Josh Mandel, Mike Gibbons, and Ohio Senator Matt Dolan, each said that an Ohio senator should tend to U.S. interests in securing the southern U.S. border and help Ukraine repel Russia’s aggression.
title: In the face of Putin’s aggression in Ukraine, JD Vance says ‘America first’
